Hi,

We are using junit 4.7 and Suite to run tests. If we take a look at th=
e example below ( from the web ...):

import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
impo=
rt org.junit.runners.Suite;
 
@RunWith(Suite.class)
@...({
 =
 TestCalculatorAddition.class,
  TestCalculatorSubtraction.class,
  TestCal=
culatorMultiplication.class,
  TestCalculatorDivision.class
})
public class=
 CalculatorSuite {
    // the class remains completely empty, 
    // being=
 used only as a holder for the above annotations
}

Is it guaranteed that T=
estCalculatorAddition.class will be executed before TestCalculatorSubtracti=
on.class ? How is the order of execution determined for a suite? Is it poss=
ible in junit 4 to determine order for test classes in suite?

br,

//mike
=
